title: ARE YOU THERE GOD? IT'S ME, MARGARET.
consensus: Effervescent and refreshingly frank about the travails of puberty, this long-awaited adaptation does full justice to Judy Blume's seminal novel.
synopsis: For over fifty years, Judy Blume's classic and groundbreaking novel Are You There God? It's Me, Margaret. has impacted generations... [More]
starring: Rachel McAdams, Abby Ryder Fortson, Elle Graham, Benny Safdie

title: HUESERA: THE BONE WOMAN
consensus: A bone-chilling body horror, Huesera offers genre fans a twisted take on What to Expect When You're Expecting.
synopsis: Valeria's joy at becoming a first-time mother is quickly taken away when she's cursed by a sinister entity. As danger... [More]
starring: Natalia Solián, Alfonso Dosal, Mayra Batalla, Mercedes Hernández

title: BLACKBERRY
consensus: With intelligence as sharp as its humor, BlackBerry takes a terrifically entertaining look at the rise and fall of a generation-defining gadget.
synopsis: 'BlackBerry' tells the story of Mike Lazaridis and Jim Balsillie, the two men that charted the course of the spectacular... [More]
starring: Jay Baruchel, Glenn Howerton, Matt Johnson, Rich Sommer

title: RYE LANE
consensus: Good news, rom-com fans: Anyone looking for a smart, funny, and heartwarming new addition to the canon can find it waiting on Rye Lane.
synopsis: Yas (Vivian Oparah) and Dom (David Jonsson), two twenty-somethings both reeling from bad break-ups, connect over the course of an... [More]
starring: David Jonsson, Vivian Oparah, Charlie Knight, Simon Manyonda

title: JOYLAND
consensus: With stunning honesty that's achingly bittersweet, Joyland tackles gender and sexual fluidity in a repressed patriarchal society with wisps of hopefulness.
synopsis: The Ranas--a happily patriarchal joint family--yearn for the birth of a baby boy to continue the family line. Their youngest... [More]
starring: Ali Junejo, Rasti Farooq, Alina Khan, Sarwat Gil.

title: FULL TIME
consensus: Led by Laure Calamy's gripping performance, Full Time serves as a sobering reminder that just staying financially afloat can sometimes feel like a white-knuckle thriller.
synopsis: Single mother Julie (César award-winning actress Laure Calamy) works a grueling job as a head chambermaid in a five-star Parisian...
starring: Laure Calamy, Anne Suarez, Geneviève Mnich, Cyril Gueï

title: RETURN TO SEOUL
consensus: Sensitively attuned to its protagonist's quest, Return to Seoul uses one woman's story to explore universal truths about the human condition.
synopsis: On an impulse to reconnect with her origins, Freddie, 25, returns to South Korea for the first time, where she...
starring: Oh Kwang-rok, Kim Sun-young, Yoann Zimmer, Louis-Do de Lencquesaing

title: PAST LIVES
consensus: A remarkable debut for writer-director Celine Song, Past Lives uses the bonds between its sensitively sketched central characters to support trenchant observations on the human condition.
synopsis: Nora and Hae Sung, two deeply connected childhood friends, are wrest apart after Nora's family emigrates from South Korea. Two...
starring: Greta Lee, Teo Yoo, John Magaro, Seung-ah Moon

title: SPIDER-MAN: ACROSS THE SPIDER-VERSE
consensus: Just as visually dazzling and action-packed as its predecessor, Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse thrills from start to cliffhanger conclusion.
synopsis: Miles Morales returns for the next chapter of the Oscar®-winning Spider-Verse saga, an epic adventure that will transport Brooklyn's full-time...
starring: Shameik Moore, Hailee Steinfeld, Oscar Isaac, Jake Johnson
directed_by: Joaquim Dos Santos, Kemp Powers, Justin K. Thompson

title: SUZUME
consensus: Suzume sees director Makoto Shinkai falling just a bit short of the bar set by previous outings -- but when the results are this visually thrilling and emotionally impactful, it's hard to find much fault.
synopsis: 17-year-old Suzume's journey begins in a quiet town in Kyushu when she encounters a young man who tells her, 'I'm looking for a door.' What Suzume finds is a single weathered door standing upright in the midst of ruins as though it was shielded from whatever catastrophe struck. Seemingly drawn by its power, Suzume reaches for the knob.... Doors begin to open one after another all across Japan, unleashing destruction upon any who are near. Suzume must close these portals to prevent further disaster. The stars. The sunset. The morning sky. Within that realm, it was as though all time had melted together in the sky--guided by these mysterious doors, Suzume's journey to close doors is about to begin.
starring: Nanoka Hara, Hokuto Matsumura, Eri Fukatsu, Hakuo Matsumoto II

title: A THOUSAND AND ONE
consensus: A tribute to parental devotion and a testament to Teyana Taylor's talent, A Thousand and One presents a heart-wrenching portrait of perseverance in the face of systemic inequity.
synopsis: A THOUSAND AND ONE follows unapologetic and free-spirited Inez (Teyana Taylor), who kidnaps six-year-old Terry from the foster care system.... [More]
starring: Teyana Taylor, Aaron Kingsley Adetola, Aven Courtney, Josiah Cross

title: THE BLUE CAFTAN
consensus: A love story shaped by some surprising contours, The Blue Caftan surveys the hidden heart with compassion and grace.
synopsis: Halim and Mina run a traditional caftan store in one of Morocco's oldest medinas. In order to keep up with... [More]
starring: Lubna Azabal, Saleh Bakri, Ayoub Messioui

title: R.M.N.
consensus: R.M.N.'s spare, elegant approach lends a deceptively cool surface to its caustic take on cultural divisions.
synopsis: Award-winning director Cristian Mungiu's (4 Months, 3 Weeks, 2 Days) gripping portrait of ethnic and economic resentments tearing at the... [More]
starring: Marin Grigore, Judith State, Monica Bîrlădeanu, Orsolya Moldován

title: YOU HURT MY FEELINGS
consensus: Smart, funny, and above all entertaining, You Hurt My Feelings finds writer-director Nicole Holofcener as sharply perceptive as ever.
synopsis: From acclaimed filmmaker Nicole Holofcener comes a sharply observed comedy about a novelist whose long standing marriage is suddenly upended... [More]
starring: Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Tobias Menzies, Michaela Watkins, Arian Moayed

title: BLUE JEAN
consensus: Bridging times past with issues that are still current, Blue Jean resonates intellectually and emotionally thanks to thoughtful direction and authentic performances.
synopsis: England, 1988 -- Margaret Thatcher's Conservative government is about to pass a law stigmatizing gays and lesbians, forcing Jean, a... [More]
starring: Rosy McEwen, Kerrie Hayes, Lydia Page, Stacy Abalogun

title: BARBIE
synopsis: To live in Barbie Land is to be a perfect being in a perfect place. Unless you have a full-on existential crisis. Or you're a Ken.
starring: Margot Robbie, Ryan Gosling, America Ferrera, Kate McKinnon, Michael Cera

title: ATTACHMENT
consensus: A possession thriller that knows the devil's in the details, Attachment scares some fresh angles out of a well-worn horror subgenre.
synopsis: ATTACHMENT is a horror romance about Maja, a has-been actress in Denmark, who falls in love with Leah, a young,... [More]
starring: Sofie Gråbøl, Josephine Park, Ellie Kendrick, David Dencik

title: SAINT OMER
consensus: A gut-punching contemplation of a woman's immigrant experience, Saint Omer puts a mother on the stand and the audience in the jury box to find humanity in the inhumane.
synopsis: Saint-Omer court of law. Young novelist Rama attends the trial of Laurence Coly, a young woman accused of killing her... [More]
starring: Kayije Kagame, Guslagie Malanda, Valérie Dréville, Aurélia Petit

title: JOHN WICK: CHAPTER 4
consensus: John Wick: Chapter 4 piles on more of everything -- and suggests that when it comes to a well-dressed Keanu Reeves dispatching his enemies in lethally balletic style, there can never be too much.
synopsis: John Wick (Keanu Reeves) uncovers a path to defeating The High Table. But before he can earn his freedom, Wick... [More]
starring: Keanu Reeves, Donnie Yen, Bill Skarsgård, Laurence Fishburne

title: HOW TO BLOW UP A PIPELINE
consensus: An explosive adaptation of Andreas Malm's treatise, How to Blow Up a Pipeline delivers a high-stakes eco-thriller ignited by riveting and complex antiheroes.
synopsis: A crew of young environmental activists execute a daring mission to sabotage an oil pipeline, in Daniel Goldhaber's taut and... [More]
starring: Ariela Barer, Kristine Froseth, Lukas Gage, Forrest Goodluck

title: THE NIGHT OF THE 12TH
consensus: A grim, well-crafted thriller, The Night of the 12th takes a finely layered look at the toxic ripple effect of violence.
synopsis: In nearly every police precinct, detectives are inevitably confronted with a case that goes unsolved. The more heinous the crime,... [More]
starring: Bastien Bouillon, Bouli Lanners, Anouk Grinberg, Mouna Soualem

title: AFTER LOVE
consensus: After Love marks an impressively nuanced feature debut for writer-director Aleem Khan -- and a brilliant showcase for Joanna Scanlan's dramatic chops.
synopsis: Set in the port town of Dover, Mary Hussain suddenly finds herself a widow following the unexpected death of her husband. A day after the burial, she discovers he has a secret just twenty-one miles across the English Channel in Calais.
starring: Joanna Scanlan, Nathalie Richards, Talid Ariss

title: M3GAN
consensus: Unapologetically silly and all the more entertaining for it, M3GAN is the rare horror-comedy that delivers chuckles as effortlessly as chills.
synopsis: M3GAN is a marvel of artificial intelligence, a life-like doll programmed to be a child's greatest companion and a parent's... [More]
starring: Allison Williams, Violet McGraw, Ronny Chieng, Brian Jordan Alvarez

title: INFLUENCER
consensus: Influencer should get plenty of likes from horror fans hungry for a smart, scary chiller with something to say.
synopsis: INFLUENCER tells the story of Madison (Emily Tennant, "Riverdale"), a popular social media influencer who is having a lonely and... [More]
starring: Emily Tennant, Cassandra Naud, Sara Canning, Rory J. Saper

title: CHILE '76
consensus: Chile '76 is an intriguing historical noir that radiographs Pinochet's patronizing and patriarchal society through the eyes of a steely bourgeois woman who dares to take a stand.
synopsis: Chile, 1976. Carmen heads off to her beach house to supervise its renovation. Her husband, children, and grandchildren come back... [More]
starring: Aline Küppenheim, Nicolás Sepúlveda, Hugo Medina, Alejandro Goic

title: The Shawshank Redemption
consensus: With its poignant story and stellar performances, The Shawshank Redemption has become a modern classic and a beloved film for audiences around the world.
synopsis: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.
starring: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton

title: The Dark Knight
consensus: Led by an iconic performance by Heath Ledger as the Joker, The Dark Knight is a gripping and visually stunning superhero film that transcends the genre.
synopsis: When the Joker wreaks havoc on Gotham City, Batman must confront his own moral dilemmas as he fights to protect the city he has sworn to defend.
starring: Christian Bale, Heath Ledger, Aaron Eckhart

title: The Matrix
consensus: The Matrix is a groundbreaking sci-fi film that combines mind-bending concepts with thrilling action sequences, creating a visually stunning and thought-provoking experience.
synopsis: A computer hacker learns about the true nature of his reality and his role in the war against the machines.
starring: Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss

title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
consensus: A New Hope is the film that launched the epic Star Wars saga, introducing audiences to a galaxy far, far away and capturing their imaginations with its unforgettable characters and timeless story.
synopsis: Luke Skywalker embarks on a journey to rescue Princess Leia from the clutches of the evil Darth Vader and help the Rebel Alliance in their struggle against the Galactic Empire.
starring: Mark Hamill, Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
consensus: The Fellowship of the Ring is the captivating first installment of the Lord of the Rings trilogy, featuring breathtaking visuals, a richly detailed world, and an epic story of good versus evil.
synopsis: A young hobbit named Frodo Baggins embarks on a perilous journey to destroy a powerful ring and save Middle-earth from the dark lord Sauron.
starring: Elijah Wood, Ian McKellen, Viggo Mortensen

title: Inception
consensus: Inception is a mind-bending and visually stunning film that takes audiences on a thrilling journey through dreams and reality, leaving them questioning what is real and what is illusion.
synopsis: A skilled thief, specializing in the extraction of valuable secrets from people's dreams, is given a seemingly impossible task of planting an idea in someone's mind.
starring: Leonardo DiCaprio, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Ellen Page

title: In the Mood for Love
consensus: In the Mood for Love is a visually stunning and emotionally resonant film that explores themes of love, desire, and missed connections in 1960s Hong Kong.
synopsis: Two neighbors form a bond when they suspect their spouses are having an affair, leading them to confront their own feelings for each other.
starring: Tony Leung, Maggie Cheung, Rebecca Pan

title: Shrek 2
consensus: Shrek 2 is a hilarious and heartwarming animated film that takes viewers on a fairy tale adventure filled with memorable characters and clever humor.
synopsis: Shrek and Fiona return from their honeymoon to find an invitation from Fiona's parents, leading them on a journey to meet the royal in-laws.
starring: Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz
directed_by: Andrew Adamson, Kelly Asbury, Conrad Vernon

title: ASTEROID CITY
consensus: Asteroid City is unlikely to win Wes Anderson many new converts, but those who respond to his signature style will find this a return to immaculately arranged form.
synopsis: The itinerary of a Junior Stargazer/Space Cadet convention (organized to bring together students and parents from across the country for fellowship and scholarly competition) is spectacularly disrupted by world-changing events.
starring: Jason Schwartzman, Scarlett Johansson, Tom Hanks, Jeffrey Wright

title: Pride and Prejudice
consensus: Pride and Prejudice is a timeless romantic drama that brings Jane Austen's classic novel to life, featuring strong performances and beautiful cinematography.
synopsis: In 19th-century England, the headstrong Elizabeth Bennet clashes with the arrogant Mr. Darcy, leading to a captivating and complex love story.
starring: Keira Knightley, Matthew Macfadyen, Rosamund Pike

title: Scream
consensus: Scream revitalized the slasher genre with its self-awareness and clever meta-commentary, delivering a thrilling and entertaining experience for horror fans.
synopsis: A masked killer terrorizes a small town, targeting a group of high school students, who must uncover the killer's identity before it's too late.
starring: Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox, David Arquette

title: Scream 2
consensus: Scream 2 successfully builds upon its predecessor with a fresh set of twists and turns, offering more suspense, scares, and self-aware humor.
synopsis: A new string of murders reminiscent of the Ghostface killer's reign of terror haunts a college campus, forcing the survivors of the first attack to confront their past fears.
starring: Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox, David Arquette

title: Scream 6
consensus: Scream 6 continues the iconic horror franchise with a new chapter of suspense, mystery, and self-referential humor, keeping audiences on the edge of their seats.
synopsis: When a new wave of killings begins in the town of Woodsboro, a new generation must face the return of Ghostface and uncover the dark secrets behind the mask.
starring: TBD

title: Spirited Away
consensus: Spirited Away is a magical and enchanting animated film that transports viewers to a fantastical world filled with imaginative creatures and a heartfelt coming-of-age story.
synopsis: A young girl named Chihiro stumbles upon a mysterious spirit world, where she must navigate through various challenges to rescue her parents and find her way back home.
starring: Rumi Hiiragi, Miyu Irino, Mari Natsuki

title: Sunset Boulevard
consensus: Sunset Boulevard is a classic film noir that masterfully explores themes of faded glory, obsession, and the dark side of Hollywood, anchored by a mesmerizing performance by Gloria Swanson.
synopsis: A struggling screenwriter becomes entangled with a faded silent film star, leading to a twisted and haunting tale of delusion and desperation.
starring: William Holden, Gloria Swanson, Erich von Stroheim

title: Casablanca
consensus: Casablanca is a timeless romantic drama that has endured as a cinematic masterpiece, featuring memorable performances, quotable dialogue, and a captivating wartime love story.
synopsis: Set in World War II-era Casablanca, an American expatriate must choose between love and virtue when his former lover and her husband seek his help to escape the Nazis.
starring: Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Paul Henreid

title: Whiplash
consensus: Whiplash is an intense and gripping drama that explores the pursuit of greatness and the sacrifices required to achieve it, fueled by electrifying performances and a pulsating soundtrack.
synopsis: A young drummer enrolls in a prestigious music conservatory, where he comes under the brutal tutelage of an esteemed but demanding instructor.
starring: Miles Teller, J.K. Simmons, Paul Reiser

title: Barry Lyndon
consensus: Barry Lyndon is a visually stunning period drama that showcases Stanley Kubrick's meticulous attention to detail, featuring breathtaking cinematography and a compelling narrative.
synopsis: An Irish rogue named Barry Lyndon navigates through 18th-century Europe, using his wit and cunning to rise in the ranks of society.
starring: Ryan O'Neal, Marisa Berenson, Patrick Magee

title: Twilight
consensus: Twilight is a supernatural romance that captivated a generation of fans with its star-crossed love story, but received mixed reviews for its pacing and character development.
synopsis: A teenage girl falls in love with a mysterious vampire, leading to a dangerous and forbidden romance that puts her life at risk.
starring: Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, Taylor Lautner

title: The Hunger Games
consensus: The Hunger Games is a thrilling dystopian adventure that resonated with audiences for its engaging story, strong performances, and social commentary.
synopsis: In a post-apocalyptic world, a young girl volunteers for a brutal televised competition where teenagers fight to the death, challenging the oppressive regime that controls their lives.
starring: Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, Liam Hemsworth

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
consensus: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone introduces audiences to the magical world of Hogwarts with its enchanting story, charming characters, and visual spectacle.
synopsis: An orphaned boy named Harry Potter discovers he is a wizard and enrolls in Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he unravels the mysteries of his past and confronts the dark forces threatening the wizarding world.
starring: Daniel Radcliffe, Rupert Grint, Emma Watson

title: AVATAR THE WAY OF WATER
consensus: Narratively, it might be fairly standard stuff -- but visually speaking, Avatar: The Way of Water is a stunningly immersive experience
synopsis: Set more than a decade after the events of the first film, 'Avatar: The Way of Water' begins to tell the story of the Sully family (Jake, Neytiri, and their kids), the trouble that follows them, the lengths they go to keep each other safe, the battles they fight to stay alive, and the tragedies they endure.
starring: Joanna Scanlan, Nathalie Richards, Talid Ariss
